goal.ch: 學生進入大學就讀，不僅是追求學識的真理，如何運用自身的專業知識善盡社會責任，亦是一個重要的課題。本課程設計希望透過「服務」，能讓學生察覺日常生活中的在地問題，並且運用科學知識鏈結在地化服務，深度了解自身周遭所面臨的公共議題，進而著手改善、解決問題。
goal.en: College students not only pursuing the truth of knowledge, but also learn how to use their professional knowledge to fulfill their social responsibilities, which is also an important topic in the education of a university. This course hopes students can perceive local problems in their daily lives and use scientific knowledge to link localized services to gain in-depth understanding of public issues facing them around them through "services", so as to improve and solve problems.

outline.ch:
***因疫情關係，實際授課內容或適當調整***
(一)準備（專業技能或觀念強化之課程安排）
本課程擬於學期初介紹服務學習的概念與宗旨，並說明服務學習的通過要求等事項。
因本學期之服務學習會與桃市清溝總動員相關，預計邀請桃園市政府水務局跟學生介紹桃市防汛清淤的展望及青年防汛營之推廣，同時說明防汛清溝的實務，讓學生理解清淤活動之目的與重要性。
(二)服務（社會實踐方案或服務計畫之安排）
本學期服務學習課程由地科院學士班與地科系共同以「防汛清溝」為主軸規劃，邀請台灣整合防災工程技術顧問有限公司及桃園市水患自主防災社區協助指導學生進行防汛清溝工作。將配合台灣整合防災工程技術顧問有限公司及桃園市水患自主防災社區規劃時間決定日期，並於4月底前完成三梯次清溝總動員活動。
(三)反思（引導學生反思並紀錄各項準備過程或服務過程之課程活動）
學生透過與在地單位的互動更了解社區所面臨的與待解決的困境，並體會除了在學校學習外，自己也有能力為防汛身體力行盡一份心力，甚至增加了學生對於社會與環境的關懷程度，願意將自主防災概念推廣至自己的家鄉鄰里與身邊的親友，帶來正面影響之連鎖反應。
(四) 慶賀（分享、感恩回饋、評量結果或成果發表之安排）
將於期末安排同學分組上臺進行服務學習成果分享，藉由分工合作與團體討論的方式，訓練學生蒐集與彙整多元資料的能力、學習認識日常生活中可能會出現的環境議題，並嘗試解決問題。而在面臨團體中的意見分歧時，亦能學習組織與溝通能力並客觀包容多元觀點。
(五) 其他符合社會參與內涵之課程規劃
參與清溝總動員活動，將由台灣整合防災工程技術顧問有限公司及桃園市水患自主防災社區志工帶領學生一起進行，活動中會教學生清溝的理論方法與技巧，也會傳達自主防災的理念。藉由活動讓學生可以跟投入志工實質交流，體會志工投入的熱情與無償付出的信念。很多事，不是因為有實質的價值才願意投入，更多的是無形的價值。
outline.en:
***Due to the Covid-19 epidemic situation, the content of class may be adjusted appropriately***
1.Preparation (Curriculum Arrangement for Enhancing Professional Skills or Concepts)
This course will introduce the concept and purpose of service learning at the beginning of the semester, and explain the requirements for passing service learning. As this semester's service learning will be related to the mobilization of the Taoyuan city drainage, it is expected to invite the Water Affairs Bureau of the Taoyuan City Government to introduce the prospects of flood control and sedimentation control in Taoyuan city, as well as the promotion of the youth flood control camp. At the same time, it will explain the practical aspects of flood and sedimentation control, allowing students to understand the purpose and importance of sedimentation activities.
2. Service (arrangement of social practice or service plan)
This semester's service learning course is jointly planned by the bachelor's program of the Institute of Earth Sciences and the Earth Science Department with the theme of "Flood and Sediment Control". Taiwan Integrated Disaster Prevention Engineering Technology Consultant Co., Ltd. and Taoyuan City Flood Self-Defense Community will be invited to assist students in conducting flood and sediment control work. The date will be decided in accordance with the planning time of Taiwan Integrated Disaster Prevention Engineering Technology Consultant Co., Ltd. and Taoyuan City Flood Self-Defense Community, and the three-stage sediment mobilization activities will be completed before the end of April.
3. Rumination (guide students to reflect on and record various preparation processes or service process curriculum activities)
Learn the way of life from our ancestors through this activity. Someone maybe think the slow and inefficient approach of fishing seems unnecessary in the modern world. However, in recent years, the voices of human overfishing and depletion of large natural resources have become louder. Is it possible to introspect and seek the best way to coexist with nature by understanding the differences between the past and the modern human beings' use of natural resources?
4. Celebration (arrangement for sharing, gratitude feedback, evaluation results or results publication)
At the end of the term, students will be arranged into groups to present their service learning achievements on stage. Through teamwork and group discussions, students will be trained to collect and consolidate diverse data, learn to recognize environmental issues that may arise in daily life, and attempt to solve problems. When facing differences of opinion in a group, students will also learn organizational and communication skills and objectively embrace multiple perspectives.
5. Other curriculum planning in line with the connotation of social participation
Participation in the Anti-Flood Ditch Cleaning Mobilization activity will be led by E-TURN ENGINEERING CONSULTANTS CO., LTD. and volunteers from Taoyuan City Flood Self-Defense Community. The volunteers will guide the students in the activity, teaching them the theories, methods, and techniques of ditch cleaning, as well as the concept of self-defense against disasters. Through the activity, students will have the opportunity to interact with the volunteer in a meaningful way, experiencing their passion and the unwavering belief in their selfless contributions. Many things are not invested because of their tangible value, but more often because of intangible values.
